The Spicy Grilled Chicken Sandwich of Your Dreams Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDThe Spicy Grilled Chicken Sandwich of Your DreamsSponsored by Heinz® Mayonnaise FacebookPinterestTwitterEmailPhotography by Chelsea Craig Makes 4 sandwiches We’re huge fans of Cutty’s in Boston from husband and wife team Rachel and Charles Kelsey. And we’re especially fond of their spicy chicken sandwich recipe made with NEW Heinz® Mayonnaise.The chicken gets a kick of heat from an overnight brine and is then grilled and stacked atop Heinz® Mayonnaise slathered pain de mie and finished with housemade dill pickles, cheddar cheese, and shredded iceberg. Now THAT’s a chicken sando!PrintIngredients__Chicken__2 oz. vegetable oil2 tsp. cayenne pepper2 tsp. sugar1/2 tsp. Sichuan peppercorns1/2 tsp. black peppercorns1/2 tsp. paprika1/4 tsp. garlic powder2 tablespoons kosher salt2.5 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs__Sandwich__8 slices high quality white pan de mie1/2 cup Heinz® Mayonnaise6 oz. thinly sliced dill pickles4 slices cheddar cheese2 cups shredded iceberg lettuceRecipe PreparationChicken PrepCombine the first 7 ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add the salt and blend the mixture until smooth. Set aside and cool. Add the chicken to the cooled marinade and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight. Grill the chicken until lightly charred on the outside and 175°. Let rest.Sandwich Assembly Spread about 1 tablespoon Heinz® Mayonnaise on each slice of bread. Divide the chicken evenly over 4 slices of bread. Divide the pickles evenly over the chicken, then top each with 1 slice of cheddar and about ½ cup shredded iceberg.
